snippet: An obsession with exports is coming at a high cost for other euro countries and its own economy.
abstract: Editorial notes the Treasury Department's semiannual report on the international economy offers blunt perspective about the German economy, and how its heavy reliance on exports is hurting weaker European countries that share the euro; contends there is much Germany can do to raise demand at home to fix the imbalance.
lead_paragraph: An obsession with exports is coming at a high cost for other euro countries and its own economy.
